Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Professional nursing roles in contemporary society covering a range of topics using discourse methodology that forms a foundation for nursing and health care.

NSP4148C - Healthcare Simulation: An Int.name: NSP4148C - Healthcare Simulation: An Interdisciplinary Simulation Experience

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Healthcare simulation and value in exploring healthcare disparities, social determinants of health, illness prevention, wellness promotion, laws/policies and interventions for healthy population and community.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to BSN Program or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An in-depth look at issues encountered in nursing practice related to the process of death, dying, and end of life.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Factors and conditions impacting the health of women.

NSP4335 - Nursing Care of the High-Risk.name: NSP4335 - Nursing Care of the High-Risk Newborn

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to BSN program; successful completion of NUR 3445 & NUR 3445L, or C.I. for RN-BSN students.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: In depth study of pathophysiology, management and nursing care of high risk newborn, emphasizing care of the neonate and factors contributing to outcomes related to morbidity and mortality.

NSP4695 - Forensic Nursing Principles an.name: NSP4695 - Forensic Nursing Principles and Practice

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to BSN program or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Forensic Nursing principles and practices applied to a variety of settings; an examination of the scope of practice of forensic nursing.

NSP4550 - Family and Interpersonal Viole.name: NSP4550 - Family and Interpersonal Violence: Perspectives for Nurses

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to a BSN program or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Family and interpersonal violence education to increase effective nursing responses including: history, categories, cycles, laws, intervention, nursing resources, protocols and resources.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of both the pharmacology and pathophysiology components of the student's current nursing program curriculum, and NUR 3225 or RN License/Eligibility or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of Emergency Department Nursing. Topics include scopes of practice, laws, economics, nursing care and management of emergent physiologic conditions in the emergency department setting.
